thread.title: Blackout Hits All of Puerto Rico

author: Arian Campo-Flores
title: Blackout Hits All of Puerto Rico
text:
Puerto Rico suffered an islandwide blackout Wednesday triggered by a power-line failure in the south, the latest setback in the island’s halting efforts to repair the electrical grid after last year’s hurricanes.
The Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority estimated it would take 24 to 36 hours to restore power to all customers. It is focusing first on re-establishing service for hospitals, water pumping systems, the main airport in San Juan and other critical facilities, said Prepa spokesman Carlos Monroig.
